para: This command loads an ℑ into an existing µ. The new ℑ must have the same physical and pixel sizes as the µ.

note.para: All &images; in &oof2; must be associated with µs;. To load an ℑ without a preexisting µ, use instead.

para: The image file can be in any format understood by the ImageMagick library. All the common formats (jpg, gif, ppm, png, tif, etc.) are acceptable.

The new ℑ will be identified within the µ by its filename (after stripping off any directory path components). If there is already an ℑ with that name in the µ, then <x> will be appended to the name, where x is an integer.
